fields.description:
We want to restrict the particular users or groups to create subtasks on the particular step(status).

I found that some properties can restrict 'permission' on the particular steps.
For example:  
jira.permission.comment.user 
jira.permission.edit.user

I think you might have 'special properties' which can restrict users or groups to create subtasks.

Thanks
Jango
fields.summary: Rrestrict to create subtasks on the particular step.

fields.description: {{"DELETE FROM OS_HISTORYSTEP WHERE ENTRY_ID='XXXXXX'"}} statements part of the delete project operation take ages on a large issue database by having to scan the table on each statement. An index on ENTRY_ID improves hugely the delete performance.
fields.summary: Missing index in OS_HISTORYSTEP impacts delete project performance

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19407].
  {panel}

Use case:

I created a search request and wanted to add it to my dashboard using the Filter Results gadget straight away. Instead, I had to go back to the dashboard, add a gadget, and then configure it.

It'd be nice if there was a quick way of doing this from the Issue Navigator screen - maybe an option from the Tools menu. You would have to prompt the user to save the filter first, unless we had a Results gadget that just took an arbitrary JQL string.

I just noticed that the Charts allow you to do this already. So it would be similar to this.
fields.summary: Ability to add a search request as a gadget on your dashboard from the tools menu or similar

fields.summary: Remove references to aui:jquery dependencies

fields.description:
Problem:

Dates always show up in blue, instead of a colour in theme with the Look and Feel configuration. This can cause some clashes.

We should define a look and feel item for dates, or simply use one of the existing ones, so that they are consistent with other UI elements.
fields.summary: Dates should be rendered using a colour from the look and feel configuration

fields.description:
Problem:

The headings of the various fragments all-throughout the new Browse Project all use dark blue as their colour, when headings in other places in JIRA take on the colours set in the Look and Feel configuration.
fields.summary: Browse Project UI elements do not use colours from look and feel configuration

fields.description:
Problem:

Setting the link colour to anything but the default changes the link colour in regular JIRA pages. However, links that appear inside Gadgets on the dashboard remain the default link colour.



Note to devs:

When reproducing this issue, make sure JIRA is not caching the CSS, otherwise you won't see the problem! (i.e. Turn dev mode off)
fields.summary: Links inside gadgets do not take on the colour set in the look and feel configuration

fields.description:
JIRA 4.0 does not run on WebLogic 10, even with the fixes for JRA-19367 it does not work.

When you enable the {{<prefer-web-inf-classes>true</prefer-web-inf-classes>}} option you end up with some ClassCastException when trying to deploy the application:

{code}
java.lang.ClassCastException: com.ctc.wstx.stax.WstxInputFactory
	at javax.xml.stream.XMLInputFactory.newInstance(XMLInputFactory.java:137)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.TldCacheHelper$TldIOHelper.parseXML(TldCacheHelper.java:124)
	at weblogic.descriptor.DescriptorCache.parseXML(DescriptorCache.java:380)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.TldCacheHelper.parseTagLibraries(TldCacheHelper.java:65)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.War.getTagInfo(War.java:891)
	at weblogic.servlet.internal.WebAppServletContext$ServletContextWebAppHelper.getTldInfo(WebAppServletContext.java:3612)
{code}

I guess WebLogic is using some parser from within JIRA or its plugins and is thus having some problems.

If you try {{<prefer-web-inf-classes>false</prefer-web-inf-classes>}} this you get the following error when booting up JIRA.

{code}
java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: join
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.transform.stage.GenerateManifestStage.execute(GenerateManifestStage.java:124)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.transform.DefaultPluginTransformer.transform(DefaultPluginTransformer.java:113)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginFactory.createOsgiPluginJar(OsgiPluginFactory.java:218)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.factory.OsgiPluginFactory.create(OsgiPluginFactory.java:152)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.deployPluginFromUnit(ScanningPluginLoader.java:115)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.loaders.ScanningPluginLoader.loadAllPlugins(ScanningPluginLoader.java:88)
	at com.atlassian.plugin.manager.DefaultPluginManager.init(DefaultPluginManager.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager.start(JiraPluginManager.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ComponentManager$PluginSystem.start(ComponentManager.java:1275)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ComponentManager.quickStart(ComponentManager.java:226)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ComponentManager.start(ComponentManager.java:210)
{code}

This is caused by accessing an old versions of commons-lang from some where. 

The full log is attached for other information. The actual problems start happening at 12/10/2009 03:44:59 PM EST. The other errors are just setup problems.

I have the install in a VM if you want to have a play.
fields.summary: Add WebLogic 10 as a supported application server for JIRA

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19397].
  {panel}

Hello,

The filter's "subscription" option comes very useful for creating a periodical email "digest" of a filter.
However, the user can only specify himself for the subscription list.

Imagine that a user would like to have a setup where a daily email is sent for a certain subscription to a select group of users. Currently the only way to ensure this is by having the select users subscribe individually. It is desirable to allow any user to expand the list of subscribers.

Thanks,
Elik
fields.summary: Expand options to create group filter subscriptions

fields.description:
We need to be able to limit the ability to link issues by the issue status. If we have two issues, and they are both closed, I do not want to be able to link them. If one or both are opened or in progress, I'd like to be able to create the link from the open issue.

We are trying to use Jira for requirement and test management as well as issue tracking, and the ability to lock down issues (requirements and tests) once they are "approved" is critical to our ability to meet regulatory requirements in the medical device field. We use the links to link issues to requirements, requirements to tests, and requirements to hazards (all different projects in Jira). This provides great traceability between hazards, requirements, and tests; however, if we cannot control the links we cannot ensure the integrity of the traceability.
fields.summary: Workflow permission to limit ability to link issues

fields.description:
User's description:

As you can see in the screenshots in the [link|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project%27s+FishEye+Changesets] you refer to Jean-Christophe is the author of the commits. And this works for me as well, but in our case the username "espen" has been used to commit certain stuff and the username "espen" exists in Jira, hence Jira automatically links the commits to the user "espen" in Jira. However the user "espen" in jira is not the author of the commits, the author of the commits has username "espen.b" in jira. We have fixed this in the fisheye "user mapping" so that the correct username shows as the commit author inside fisheye, but when slecting source in jira it says that "espen", not "espen.b" is the author
fields.summary: User mapping for the committer in the Subversion

fields.description:
This API works, but does not allow you to specify the comment author. It ignores the "author" field and instead uses the logged-in user. Naturally, in an integration scenario, you dont want to use the logged-in user but rather be able to specify who has made the comment.

Please not that not all SOAP APIs work in that manner: the createIssue API (which is very similar in nature to addComment) takes in a "reporter" field and uses it to capture the user who reported the issue, this gives the external application the ability to correctly create an issue on behalf of a user, while such ability does not exist when you try to create a comment, thus, making the createComment API somewhat pointless. I think this can be easily fixed by adding a new "reporter" attribute to the RemoteComment object or using the existing "author" or "updateAuthor" attributes.

This is a major issue for our company as our service depends on integration with Jira over SOAP. Thank you for your attention.
fields.summary: addComment SOAP API

But when i try to edit my new scheme I always get "You must select at least one option"

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19383].
  {panel}

There are currently four distinct hues of blue used on the dashboard screen, which makes it look a bit inconsistent. How do these fit with the JIRA colour scheme?

The four colours are:

- top header: #003366
- bottom header: #3c78b5
- gadget header: #336699
- gadget menu background: #325c82

I think the gadget menu background should probably be #369, and perhaps the bottom header too.

(I won't even comment on the myriad shades of grey used, but there are way more than four.)

fields.description:
In today's fast paced environment changes in existing products are very frequent and developers have to roll out new versions. As a windows developer for me standard way to release software is through MSI Scripts. It's a known fact that if we push the responsibility of creating these scripts to a developer then we can reduce the number of bugs which arise due to release processes. This is more true for the applications (And I believe there is a significant amount of these) which are based on extensible Plugin Arhitecture. 
Once the scripts are ready QA/customers needs to be notified whenever there is a new version or a new product release and they need to provided a way to be able to download and install it on their machines.
Here I want to specify that our users request for private products (which only they know about as these are their tested strategies) so security is also a major concern here.
As a developer I would always prefer products which can be integrated easily and I do not want to go to different vendors for different needs so that I can focus on my business needs.

So one critical feature that should be available in JIRA is :

1.) Provide a facility to link files with the version.
2.) This should be customizable so that I can put my files in a particular location and whenever I do a "Release" files should be automatically downloadable for that particular version.
3.) Provide a facility to differentiate between release types (Internal/Public/Private etc.). 
4.) Provide a facility to be able to create "Customer Accounts" who can only see public releases. For private release I should be able to "Select" particular accounts.

3.)
fields.summary: Add ability to link files/installation scripts to a specific release

fields.description:
We always get bitten on customer upgrades where they just use their old jira-application.properties.  This is really bad when we add new properties and don't have a default programatically provided.

It should work like this:
# On upgrade, if no file exists in home directory, we copy over the jira-application.properties with everything commented out. (or we can do some smart diffing and recreation)
# The user can uncomment and edit any property they want.
# When we retrieve this value we check the database, their property file and then lastly our file.

This would ease quite a bit of customer pain on upgrades.
fields.summary: Create jira-application.properties override/overlay file for customers to make upgrades easier

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19348].
  {panel}

It would be nice if the new smart menus would remember the last admin sections I visited (I think 5 would be good but it should be configurable from the jira-application.properties file)

The way I see it working is:

* Add javascript to the admin decorator (include a web resource rather than inline javascript).  This will add a click listener to all admin links.  This listener will do an ajax request to a REST end-point.  This listener doesn't stop the page navigating to the desired page.
* Rest end-point - This will take the id (from the id attribute of the anchor) and store it in persisted history
* Persisted history - create a AdminUserHistoryManager (very similar to ProjectUserHistoryManager)
* create AdminHistorySimpleLinkFactory (similar to ProjectHistoryLinkFactory) and add it to system-top-navigation-plugin.xml.

Will need unit tests for the AdminUserHistoryManager, AdminHistorySimpleLinkFactory and AdminHistoryResource (REST).

Selenium tests to for functional coverage.

Note. AdminUserHistoryManager should most probably just deal with keys (Strings).
AdminHistorySimpleLinkFactory will need to convert keys to WebItems to SimpleLinks.
To convert keys to WebItems - get all JiraWebItemModuleDescriptors from the PluginAccessor using a ModuleDescriptor predicate that checks for the link id.
Look at the SimpleLinkManager on how to convert these to SimpleLinks.  (Most probably extract this logic into a helper class).
fields.summary: Remember Admin pages I have visited and display the last 5 in the Admin menu

3. The same gadget gets added if hssql.
 
Expected:
1. User should be able to add the external gadget without any problem.

fields.description:
From JSP-44736,

We have a lot of users in Jira and it's quite hard to keep track of who is already a user and who is not. Since one user can be in several projects. I don't find out until I already written all the information in the form. 

Since the username is unique it would be create if I in the first step can get a clue that the person already is a user. Like when you add a user to a group by each letter I write it gets closer to the user I want. If we could have the same function here I would know if that person already is a user or not.

fields.description:
According to http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257319878 the JIRA 4.0 source release does not compile properly.

{quote}
I'm in the team in charge of preparing Scarlet, the clustered edition of JIRA4.

I'm unable to compile JIRA 4.0 (final, as far as I know) as it's depending on several artifacts which are not available.

For example it requires atlassian-template-renderer-velocity16-plugin-1.0.2.jar, but in the /velocity1.6 directory there's version atlassian-template-renderer-velocity1.6-plugin-1.0.1.jar (an older version); I might have the same problem for other artifacts.

To build jira-fisheye-plugin doesn't build because jira-subproject-plugins (the parent artifact) is missing,
atlassian-gadgets-dashboard-plugin-1.0.3.jar is missing,
atlassian-gadgets-renderer-plugin-1.0.3.jar is missing, and many others.

Please keep in mind that your partners need to be able to compile the code, but we don't have access to Atlassian's artifact repositories nor to Atlassian's non-public source code repository, so we have to compile each dependency ourself.

Could someone please fix the sources tarball for version 4.0 ? 
{quote}

We need to investigate this.  

Toby R did a specific test of this INSIDE Atlassian infrastructure but we may have another problem with maven access outside the Atlassian infrastructure.
fields.summary: Source build is for 4.0 is broken

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to view a trend of issues within a filter or project.

For example, it would nice to see, over time, the count of filtered issues (e.g., unresolved) by priority.  A sample graph can be seen on the following page.
 - http://blogs.onresolve.com/?p=50

Similarly, a trend line on average age would be good.

I like the average age portlet that is included.  Unfortunately, it just doesn't allow me to segregate the issues by priority.
fields.summary: Extend dashboard portlets to display trends based on a property

fields.description:
I am really enjoying the visibility that the charting gives on the dashboards.

I am hoping that some of the charts could work off calculations of date fields.  In particular, I'd like to see variants of a filter statistic and a two-dimensional filter statistic.

Instead of graphing the count of issues that match the filter, graph the result of a calculation (e.g., average age, average time since last updated, max age, ...).

E.g., I would very much like to break out issues within a filter by priority and see the average age.  Or, since I have a field that tracks the customer for each issue, I'd like to see a 2D filter stats that breaks out average age by customer and by priority.  This would allow me to see if any of our customers are not being serviced to the same level.  Also, I'm interested in making sure that our service levels are being met, so being able to calculate the average age, or max age, and break it out by priority would be a great help.
fields.summary: Add ability to display age statistics in dashboard portlets

fields.description:
Some companies such as Salesforce and Parature (http://www.parature.com/liveproductdemo.aspx) are starting to use a particular feature to reduce the number of duplicate issues filed and also reduce the load on their support teams. While the summary text is being entered for a new issue, the existing issues are searched for matching terms and the user is presented with possible answers to their question or existing issues. This seems like a good, solid idea and has been suggested to me by a number of existing JIRA customers. 

Please consider it for an upcoming JIRA release, thanks.
fields.summary: Help avoid duplicate issues by searching existing issues during issue creation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-19329].
  {panel}

Top item in the activity stream is under heading "October 05 - 10:00 PM"

Our date formats:
	Format	Example
  Time Format	kk:mm 'UTC'	14:41 UTC
  Day Format	EEEE kk:mm 'UTC'	Tuesday 14:41 UTC
  Complete Date/Time Format	yyyy-MM-dd kk:mm 'UTC'	2009-10-06 14:41 UTC
  Day/Month/Year Format	yyyy-MM-dd	2009-10-06
  Date Picker Format (javascript format)	d/MMM/yy (%e/%b/%y)	6/Oct/09
  Date Time Picker Format (javascript format)	dd/MMM/yy hh:mm a (%e/%b/%y %I:%M %p)	06/Oct/09 02:41 PM

h3. Note

Streams currently uses different formats for time an date:

* Time. It is always the value specified in the field "Time Format" in the Look & Feel config page. The time if not displayed if the date is today.
* Date. It varies, depending on the actual date:
** For today's dates:
*** < 1 minute:  "Moments ago"
*** < 2 minutes: "1 minute ago"
*** < 1 hour: "X minutes ago"
*** < 2 hours: "1 hour ago"
*** < 1 day: "X hours ago"
** Yesterday: "Yesterday at {{time}}"
** Last week: "{{dddd}} at {{time}}" (eg. Sunday at 09:00 am)
** Last year: "{{m}} at {{time}}" (eg. 11 May at 09:00 am)
** Older: "{{D}} at {{time}}" (eg. Sunday, 11 May 2014 at 09:00 am)

The time & date format specifiers are documented below:
* https://code.google.com/p/datejs/wiki/FormatSpecifiers#CUSTOM_DATE_AND_TIME_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS
* https://code.google.com/p/datejs/wiki/FormatSpecifiers#STANDARD_DATE_AND_TIME_FORMAT_SPECIFIERS

Note: the format specifier {{a}} is translated to {{tt}}, so the default time format ({{h:mm a}}) is actually interpreted as ({{h:mm tt}})
fields.summary: Activity stream date format does not use configured format

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Oracle will not permit more than 1000 literals in an IN clause. It does, however, permit SELECT statements in the IN clause which can return an unlimited number of elements. This causes problem as OfBiz will attempt to query an Oracle DB with IN clauses that have >1k literals and will throw exceptions.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to a JIRA instance with more than 1000 projects
2. Go into the "User Browser"
3. For any user, click on the "Project Roles" link

This can also be reproduced anywhere within JIRA where OfBiz queries the database in this manner, for example:

* Accessing the Activity Stream.
* Viewing a large change history on an issue.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA functions without error.

h3. Actual Results

This will generate the following SQL (Oracle) error:

{noformat}
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT DISTINCT PID FROM projectroleactor WHERE (PROJECTROLEID=? AND ROLETYPE=? AND ROLETYPEPARAMETER=?) AND (PID IN (?, ?, ?, ?,... ) ) (ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000
{noformat}

In SQL Server it will display a {{Prepared or callable statement has more than 2000 parameter markers}} error.

h3. Notes

It seems that this can also use up connections in the DBCP and not release them back into the pool, subsequently multiple interactions with the database that experience this error can cause the DBCP to time out and JIRA will cease to function properly (as it cannot obtain connections from the DB). This is not currently verified, however has been anecdotally viewed on customer instances and was corrected by working around the SQL that was causing these errors. This was caused by issues with large history records (over 1k) and deleting some of the history records or restricting the access of the issue corrected the problem. This presents with the following exception:

{noformat}
2013-04-10 08:25:22,407 StreamsCompletionService::thread-19910 ERROR cemerine 500x1935299x29 i2att9 3.185.141.134,3.239.244.206 /plugins/servlet/streams [atlassian.streams.internal.LocalActivityProvider] Error building feed
com.atlassian.jira.exception.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID FROM (SELECT jiraissue.ID FROM jiraissue jiraissue INNER JOIN changegroup cg ON jiraissue.ID = cg.issueid WHERE (jiraissue.PROJECT IN (?, ?, ?) AND (cg.AUTHOR IN (?) ) ORDER BY cg.CREATED DESC) WHERE ROWNUM <= 10 (ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000
)
	at com.atlassian.jira.ofbiz.DefaultOfBizDelegator.findListIteratorByCondition(DefaultOfBizDelegator.java:489)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.changehistory.DefaultChangeHistoryManager.findMostRecentlyUpdatedIssueIdsByUsers(DefaultChangeHistoryManager.java:390)
...
Caused by: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDataSourceException: SQL Exception while executing the following:SELECT ID FROM (SELECT jiraissue.ID FROM jiraissue jiraissue INNER JOIN changegroup cg ON jiraissue.ID = cg.issueid WHERE (jiraissue.PROJECT IN (?, ?, ?) ) AND (cg.AUTHOR IN (?) ) ORDER BY cg.CREATED DESC) WHERE ROWNUM <= 10 (ORA-01795: maximum number of expressions in a list is 1000
)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.jdbc.SQLProcessor.executeQuery(SQLProcessor.java:605)
	at org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericDAO.selectListIteratorByCondition(GenericDAO.java:1059)
{noformat}

And can be verified with the below SQL:

{code:SQL}
SELECT count(*) AS ttl_records, 
       p.pkey,
       ji.issuenum
FROM   changeitem ci 
       JOIN changegroup cg 
         ON cg.id = ci.groupid 
       JOIN jiraissue ji 
         ON ji.id = cg.issueid 
       JOIN project p
         ON ji.project = p.id
GROUP  BY p.pkey, ji.issuenum
HAVING count(*) >= 1000
ORDER  BY ttl_records DESC;
{code}
fields.summary: Ofbiz generates queries with large IN clauses that result in ORA-01795 errors

fields.description:
When attachments are uploaded, they are not incorporating the file permissions of the destination "attachments" folder.  Instead, they are maintaining the permissions of the "temp" folder used by the email handler (and *presumably* the file upload handler as well).

A resolution to this problem is to reset the file permissions so they inherit the permissions of the destination folder.  For an example, the built-in ICACLS command provides this functionality with the following command to replaces ACLs with default inherited ACLs:

   ICACLS <filename> /reset

Background: After a recent hardware upgrade and OS reload, we have noticed problems backing up our attachments folder.  It turns out the permissions of uploaded attachments were using the permissions from the "C:\Windows\Temp" folder.  Windows maintains permissions of file when moving a file from one folder to another.  (A "copy" operation, on the other hand, will use the permissions inherited by the destination folder.)  As purely a workaround, we are now setting permissions on the window's temp folder as we need them in the attachments folder.  This is clearly bad in general since the permissions will necessarily clash in some environments.
fields.summary: Attachment's File Permissions Incorrect when Upoloaded with Email Handler

When I see a project road map, for instance:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA#selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.project%3Aroadmap-panel
I can see several versions. Each of them has a progress bar. Clicking on the each part (green or red) of this progress bar is supposed to bring us the issue navigator showing resolved or unresolved issues in a chosen version.

The problem is that the jqlQuery in these links only specifies resolution status, not mentioning version we're clicking on.

fields.description:
■ Steps to reproduce

0. Sign in to JIRA, ensure the user's locale is set to English.
1. Select "Find Issues", and expose the search criterion UI.
2. Set a field in "Dates & Times". For example, set "Created Before" to the value representing "2009 June 20th."
3. Execute the search (Click "view").
4. Click "permlink".
5. After the browser finishes navigating to the "permalink" URL, observe the related portion of the URL.
Following our example, it will be: "... &created%3Abefore=20%2FJun%2F09 ..."

Repeating this process while, for example, Chinese & Japanese user locales in effect produces different URLs.
Following our example:

zh: "... &created%3Abefore=20%2F%E5%85%AD%E6%9C%88%2F09 ..."    (rendered as '20/六月/09')
ja: "... &created%3Abefore=20%2F6%2F09 ..."    (rendered as '20/6/09')
en: "... &created%3Abefore=20%2FJun%2F09 ..."    (rendered as '20/Jun/09')

To reproduce the problem, visit one of the links whose date portion of the URL is encoded using any locale but your current one.
JIRA will greet the visitor with this message (in the case of English):
    "There are errors with your search query on the left, please correct them before continuing."

As is, this phenomenon renders the valuable permlink feature inoperable between users of differing locales,
which leads to frustration of business processes.



■ Desired Behavior

Such dates embedded in URLs are encoded in a single canonical format regardless of locale.
Users in various world regions can successfully share & use permlink URLs with each other.
fields.summary: Search results permlink URL varies based on UI locale

fields.description:
With JIRA 4.0, portlets as an integration point with Confluence are still supported such that a Confluence page can contain the Jira Portlet Macro. However, the instructions for this macro will no longer be correct as of JIRA 4.0. 

The old way of configuring the macro was to first configure a portlet, then get the "RunPortlet" URL and paste it into the Macro.

The new JIRA dashboard does not easily let a user discover this legacy url for a configured portlet, nor does it let a user configure a portlet with a UI.

When Confluence 3.1 is released, it will support a Gadget macro which supercedes the portlet macro, but according to Charles this Gadget macro requires too much back end to work in Confluence 3.0 and earlier.

At the very least we need to update the Confluence docs for using the JIRA portlet macro.

In JIRA We could:

# enable the legacy dashboard to be used behind a hidden URL for this purpose
# Document the fact that the old process is gone and handle requests in support. If the demand is very low during the gap between JIRA 4.0 and Confluence 3.1, this may be feasible.
# Document how to create portlet URLs from scratch (there are one or two dozen parameters which must be entered on a URL)
# Create Instructions for users to enable the legacy portlet gadget bridge to expose the portlet urls.
# Add some functionality into JIRA 4.0.x for portlet URL configuration (based on the legacy code still there)
fields.summary: Support the easy configuration of portlets for integration with the Confluence portlet macro
